alert.note: Alert for Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:08PM EST until February 21 at 10:45AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Belleville Lock affecting Meigs, Wood and Jackson Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Belleville Lock. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Ohio State Route 124 is flooded north of Stiversville Road, at Rock Run, at Wells Run to Smith Ridge to Dewitts Run, at Forked Run, at Curtis Hollow Road and between Long Bottom and Shade River. Ohio State Route 124 near the Washington and Meigs County line is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 34.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 36.5 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.5 feet on 04/05/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1015 AM EST.
